meanings.definition: A type of marine mollusk with a brightly colored, glossy shell.
meanings.sent1: The beach was covered in beautiful cowries.
meanings.sent2: She collected cowries to make a pretty necklace.
meanings.sent3: The cowries on the seashore seemed to be smiling at us.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like cowries in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The child's laughter echoed like the sound of cowries rolling in the waves.

meanings.definition: The shell of this mollusk, used historically as currency in some cultures.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people traded goods for cowries.
meanings.sent2: The merchant's wealth was measured in cowries.
meanings.sent3: He tried to pay for his meal with a handful of cowries, much to the amusement of the waiter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than all the cowries in the world.
meanings.sent5: The sound of cowries clinking together was music to their ears.
